alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Dubuque (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 28 at 7:52PM CDT until July 28 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Dubuque County in northeastern Iowa... Delaware County in northeastern Iowa... * Until 845 PM CDT. * At 752 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Greeley to near Buffalo Creek Park, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Dubuque, Manchester, Asbury, Dyersville, Cascade, Epworth, Farley, Peosta, Earlville, Hopkinton, Delhi, New Vienna, Worthington, Ryan, Greeley, Delaware, Centralia, Sageville, Bernard and Bankston. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
